wiki.summary: "Stay with Me" is a song by British singer-songwriter Sam Smith, released as the third single from their debut studio album, In the Lonely Hour (2014). It was released in the United Kingdom as a digital download on 18 May 2014. The song was written by Smith, Jimmy Napes. The remix version features American R&B singer Mary J. Blige. It has peaked at #2 on the Billboard Hot 100, making it Smith's first top-five single in the United States. It took home the 2015 Grammy for "Song of the Year". Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Stay with Me" is a song by British singer-songwriter Sam Smith, released as the third single from their debut studio album, In the Lonely Hour (2014). It was released in the United Kingdom as a digital download on 18 May 2014. The song was written by Smith, Jimmy Napes. The remix version features American R&B singer Mary J. Blige. It has peaked at #2 on the Billboard Hot 100, making it Smith's first top-five single in the United States. It took home the 2015 Grammy for "Song of the Year". On 25 March 2014, the song was played for the first time on Zane Lowe's BBC Radio 1 show at 7:30pm. On 29 March, they performed the song live on Saturday Night Live in the United States. On 16 May, they performed the song on The Graham Norton Show. In June, they returned to the United States as part of their tour where they performed the song on Good Morning America, at the Apollo Theater in New York with Mary J. Blige, and David Letterman. It peaked at #1 in Canada, Croatia, Ireland, Israel, New Zealand, Scotland, and the United Kingdom. It also charted at #5 in Australia, #2 in the United States, #4 in Sweden, #3 in the Netherlands, #6 in Switzerland, #6 in Italy, #3 in Denmark, #8 in the Flanders region of Belgium, #11 in Germany, #9 in the Wallonia region of Belgium, #3 in Austria, #14 in the Czech Republic, #6 in France, and #4 in Slovakia. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
